info.author: Marco Masetti
info.description:
# p2-store

## Description

A simple web service meant to mainly store:
* experiments
* experiment sessions
* experiment logs
* k8s resources
* Any other item that needs persistence


## Installing Dependencies

    pip install -r p2_store/requirements.txt

## test

    make test

## Module local installation

    make install

## Build distribution

    make dist

## Release it
Note: pypi username/password in envars PYPI_USER_NAME/PYPI_PASSWORD

    make release


## Routes

The service exposes the following routes:

### Experiment management routes:

| Method | Path | JSON-encoded Payload | Description |
|--------|------|----------------------|-------------|
|POST|/store/experiment|{filename, data}|Uploads a new experiment|
|DELETE|/store/experiment|{filename}|Deletes an experiment|
|GET|/store/experiments||returns the list of all experiments as json|
|GET|/store/experiment/filename||returns the experiment data as json|

### Experiment sessions management routes:

#### The session object
| Name| Description |
|-----|-------------|
|exp_id| Unique session identifier, mandatory when creating a new session|
|filepath| The filename or relative path to the experiment (mandatory when creating a new session)|
|schedule| The time at which the execution has been scheduled|
|start_time| When the expetiment actually started|
|end_time| When the experiment actually ended|
|status| The experiment execution status as reported by Chaostoolkit in the experiment journal|


#### The routes:
| Method | Path | JSON-encoded Payload | Description |
|--------|------|----------------------|-------------|
|POST|/store/experiment/session|A session object|Creates a new session record|
|GET|/store/experiment/paged_exp_sessions||Returns a dict with keys:      
||||            - records: a list of exp_sessions  
||||            - count  : total number of sessions  
||||        Input query params:  
||||            - offset: number of record to start with  
||||            - size  : number of sessions to retrieve (default => 10)|


### Experiment logs management routes:

#### The log object
| Name| Description |
|-----|-------------|
|exp_id|Reference to the experiment session this log belongs to (mandatory)|
|log_type|Possible values: 1=execution command output log, 2=chaostoolkit.log 3=journal.log (mandatory)|
|log_text|The log text (mandatory)|


#### The routes:
| Method | Path | JSON-encoded Payload | Description |
|--------|------|----------------------|-------------|
|POST|/store/experiment/log|A log object| Adds a type of log referencing the experiment id
|GET|/store/experiment/logs?exp_id=<exp_id>||Gets all logs associated with this exp_id
info.name: p2-store
info.summary: A service to serve P2 store
info.html_description:
p2-store

Description

A simple web service meant to mainly store:

  • experiments
  • experiment sessions
  • experiment logs
  • k8s resources
  • Any other item that needs persistence

Installing Dependencies

pip install -r p2_store/requirements.txt

test

make test

Module local installation

make install

Build distribution

make dist

Release it

Note: pypi username/password in envars PYPI_USER_NAME/PYPI_PASSWORD

make release

Routes

The service exposes the following routes:

Experiment management routes:

Method Path JSON-encoded Payload Description
POST /store/experiment {filename, data} Uploads a new experiment
DELETE /store/experiment {filename} Deletes an experiment
GET /store/experiments returns the list of all experiments as json
GET /store/experiment/filename returns the experiment data as json

Experiment sessions management routes:

The session object

Name Description
exp_id Unique session identifier, mandatory when creating a new session
filepath The filename or relative path to the experiment (mandatory when creating a new session)
schedule The time at which the execution has been scheduled
start_time When the expetiment actually started
end_time When the experiment actually ended
status The experiment execution status as reported by Chaostoolkit in the experiment journal

The routes:

Method Path JSON-encoded Payload Description
POST /store/experiment/session A session object Creates a new session record
GET /store/experiment/paged_exp_sessions Returns a dict with keys:
- records: a list of exp_sessions
- count : total number of sessions
Input query params:
- offset: number of record to start with
- size : number of sessions to retrieve (default => 10)

Experiment logs management routes:

The log object

Name Description
exp_id Reference to the experiment session this log belongs to (mandatory)
log_type Possible values: 1=execution command output log, 2=chaostoolkit.log 3=journal.log (mandatory)
log_text The log text (mandatory)

The routes:

Method Path JSON-encoded Payload Description
POST /store/experiment/log A log object Adds a type of log referencing the experiment id
GET /store/experiment/logs?exp_id=<exp_id> Gets all logs associated with this exp_id
